hero.title: Teaching the <highlight>modern web</highlight> in two languages
hero.subtitle: From Nope→Web exists because learning to code shouldn't require knowing English first. We're building the bridge between Arabic-speaking beginners and the global developer community.

story.label: The Story
story.paragraph1: I started coding because someone took the time to explain things in a way that made sense. That moment of clarity, where confusion transforms into understanding, is what we're chasing.
story.paragraph2: For millions of Arabic speakers, that moment is harder to reach. Not because the concepts are too difficult, but because the resources assume English fluency. Technical documentation, tutorials, error messages, all in a language that adds an extra layer of difficulty.
story.paragraph3: From Nope→Web is our answer to this challenge. A structured, bilingual curriculum that treats Arabic and English as first-class languages. No second-rate translations. No afterthoughts. Just clear, progressive education in the language you think in.
